attributes.action: to change the restrictions on tattoo policy for armed forces and police force give us all a chance.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: i and many people i know have been rejected from the armed forces to to having visible tattoos this policy has only been in affect a few years before this came into effect people where allowed to have them i know a few people who have been in a long time and have these do have visible tattoos do us as a society wish to stop the future generations of young people getting jobs like this having tattoos is part of our generation prejudice is a common factor her i can therefor understand that visible tattoos which are offensive to others should not be allowed but non offensive this is just wrong if i got turned away from a job due to the fact i had tattoos i could seek legal advice on discrimination but this does not seem to be the factor when applying for a job as a solider we are allowed to risk are lives for our country but sorry no tattoos allowed this is absurd gordan brown is all for equal opportunities in the work place does that mean this does not apply to me lift the restriction policy on tattoos or at least consider a much less harsher policy
